thread.title: 'Hamilton' in Houston: There's a new way to get tickets
thread.title_full: 'Hamilton' in Houston: There's a new way to get tickets - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: 'Hamilton' in Houston: There's a new way to get tickets
text:
Photo: Joan Marcus, HONS Image 1 of / 3 3 FILE - In this file photo released by The Public Theater, Lin-Manuel Miranda, foreground, performs with members of the cast of the musical "Hamilton" in New York. A group dedicated to studying Alexander Hamilton will gather Thursday, July 7, 2016, in New Jersey. One of the researchers, Michael Newton, says that he has traced the story that Martha Washington named her feral tomcat after Hamilton to a piece of satire written by a man described as a British captain. The tale is included in a song in the hit Broadway show "Hamilton" and in the biography that it's based on. (Joan Marcus/The Public Theater via AP, File) MANDATORY CREDIT less FILE - In this file photo released by The Public Theater, Lin-Manuel Miranda, foreground, performs with members of the cast of the musical "Hamilton" in New York. A group dedicated to studying Alexander ... more Photo: Joan Marcus, HONS Image 2 of 3 Christopher Jackson, left, as George Washington and Javier Munoz in the title role of the Broadway musical "Hamilton" at the Richard Rodgers Theater in New York,. Even among historians who love the musical and its multiethnic cast, a question has also quietly simmered: does Ã©HamiltonÃ© really get Hamilton right? (Sara Krulwich/The New York Times) less Christopher Jackson, left, as George Washington and Javier Munoz in the title role of the Broadway musical "Hamilton" at the Richard Rodgers Theater in New York,. Even among historians who love the musical and ... more Photo: SARA KRULWICH, STF Image 3 of 3 Okieriete Onaodowan, Daveed Diggs, Anthony Ramos and Lin-Manuel Miranda in ÂHamiltonÂ at the Richard Rodgers Theater in New York, July 11, 2015. In its move to Broadway, the show about AmericaÂs founding fathers is proof that the musical is not only surviving but evolving in ways that should allow it to thrive. (Sara Krulwich/The New York Times) less Okieriete Onaodowan, Daveed Diggs, Anthony Ramos and Lin-Manuel Miranda in ÂHamiltonÂ at the Richard Rodgers Theater in New York, July 11, 2015. In its move to Broadway, the show about AmericaÂs ... more Photo: SARA KRULWICH, STF 'Hamilton' in Houston: There's a new way to get tickets 1 / 3 Back to Gallery Tickets for the oft-sold-out Broadway show "Hamilton," which comes to Houston between April 24 and May 20, 2018, have been available for purchasers of the full season for Broadway at the Hobby Center.
But now, another theater is offering a similar deal. Theatre Under the Stars announced today that a full, six-show season subscription for 2017-18 will include "Hamilton." Purchases must be made before March 31, 2017.
Seats to "Hamilton" through the TUTS season pass will be for the May 1-13 performances.
TUTS, far from the only theater in the country to use "Hamilton" to encourage season sales, has announced its full mainstage lineup for 2017-18. It is "The Secret Garden" (Oct. 10-22), "Sleeping Beauty and Her Winter Knight" (Dec. 6-24), "Memphis" (Feb. 20 - March 4, 2018), "Bright Star" (March 13-25), "Hamilton" (May 1-13, special arrangement) and "Guys and Dolls" (June 12-24, 2018).
For additional information and to purchase 2017-18 season subscriptions, visit TUTS.com or call 713-558-8887.
